content: skinny scarf by barbara hurd skinny scarf is knit mostly in garter stitch from a small amount of homespun and is a skinny parallelogram with lace stripes it can be knit in store bought yarn the thin yarn combined with the lace holes keep you warm but not overheated the pattern is easy to memorize quick to knit and perfect for uneven or first homespun i love the rugged look of this rough single-ply homespun not into lace just switch colors for solid stripes it would be perfect for school or team colors too pick your most complimentary color because this scarf loves to make you look and feel good pick a color that will set off your eyes or your locks needles single pointed us size 9 yarn 17 wpi of homespun wool something soft approx 100 yards of main color 25 contrasting color pink scarf knit in spud and chloe fine sock yarn i used approx 125 yards from the 248yd skein and unknown off-white leftover yarn from other project gauge 17 sts/4 inches in garter stitch 34 row or 17 ridges in garter stitch/4 height approximately stitches used a k1 kfb knit in front and back of next stitch knit to 3 stitches sts from end k2tog knit 2 decrease k1 b k1 k2tog knit to 2 sts from end kfb k1 lace 1 k1 kfb *y/o yarn over k2tog repeat from * to last 2 sts k2tog don t get fooled here and y/o before the last k2tog… there s no y/o 2 k2 *y/o p2tog purl 2 together repeat from * to last 2 sts k2 don t knit them together begin cast on 30 stitches knit row a and b until approximately 10 ridges end having completed row b in new color create lace knit row 1 and 2 knit row a and b knit row 1 and 2 six row total switch color knit row a and b until approximately 20 ridges end having completed row b change color insert lace row 1 2 a b 1 2 change color knit row a and b until 20 ridges change color insert lace row 1 2 a b 1 2 change color knit row a and b until 10 ridges bind off loosely sew in all ends onto the corresponding color so they re hidden wet the scarf gently squeeze out water roll it in a towel to absorb excess water then pin to block wrap gently loop closed and enjoy your beautiful creation if you are able please donate to veteran/military suicide prevention or your local senior center mine is the center at belvedere i hope you feel the joy of charity copyright barbara hurd 2022
